content.description:
Traverse the crack to the right using mostly tight hands. The crux is the topout with awkward feet. It is fun!

I ended up using the shelf below the crack for feet for most of the way.
content.location: I did a stand start where my hands could fit in the crack.

climbs.name: Home Slice
climbs.fa: Tyler Dziedzina, Autumn, the German Shepard

content.description:
Yet another offwidth roof boulder, these things are everywhere!

Start under the A-frame and kick into the offwidth, pivot, go up, and you are done. This is not the greatest crack boulder, but it is certainly worthy of doing if you are in the area and don't want to move around too much.
content.location:
It is approximately 50 yards east of "

Let 'er Buck

."

content.description: This is a high quality, 45+ degree overhanging crack problem that starts as hands but quickly widens to offwidth size. As usual with these inverted offwidth boulders, the pivot is the crux, and it's a bit of a fight to get over the lip. This problem would get 4 stars, but it still needs some further cleaning and more ascents to get it up to par with the other classic crack boulders in the area.
content.protection: Several pads and a maybe a spotter for the pivot.
content.location:
It is 20 yards west of

"Let 'er Buck"

at approximate GPS coordinates: 39.33354, -105.27003.

climbs.name: Dystopian Dream Girl
climbs.fa: Tyler Dziedzina, Autumn the German Shepard

content.description:
Start under the roof in a flaring handjam and ok fingerlock and work your way up the crack. It is a classic in my opinion but not as aesthetic as some of the other fingercracks in the area. This is a step up in difficulty from "

In Rainbows

" for sure, with thin and precise finger locks. Easier for the folks with smaller fingers!
content.protection: Just one pad will do. Highly recommend taping fingers before you get on this, the locks can be sharp.
content.location:
It is about 100 or so yards north of

"Let 'er Buck"

.

GPS coordinates are: 39.334298, -105.269486.
